subject: Re: [junit] Re: testing WebStart apps
msgSnippet: ... I checked out the JWebUnit Javadoc, but did not see any special functionality to support javascript events?(http://jwebunit.sourceforge.net/) The doc also
messageBody:
Curt Sampson wrote:

> On Tue, 18 Nov 2003, Chad Woolley wrote:
>
> > One of the things I liked about JWebUnit was the ability to also test
> > JavaScript (onload/onclick events). That can give you a lot better
> > functional coverage if you app uses Javascript. I'm pretty sure
> > HTTPUnit doesn't offer this (JWebUnit is build on HTTPUnit, I believe).

I checked out the JWebUnit Javadoc, but did not see any special functionality to support javascript events?(http://jwebunit.sourceforge.net/)
The doc also does not mention anything, Am I missing anything?

>
> > Does HTMLUnit or any other free tool offer this?
>
> Ok, a bit of an old message to be replying to, but HttpUnit does let you
> test JavaScript, it seems; you just need to be using the Rhino classes
> (the js.jar file) that come with it.
>
> I should also mention a true unit-testing framework for servlets that I
> wrote: servtest (http://servtest.sourceforge.net/). This is essentially
> a small servlet container to which you give a servlet, set up a request,
> and ask the container to execute the servlet. At the end you can check
> what the servlet did. I find this to be a lot faster for initial testing
> of servlets than very heavyweight functional-testing systems like HttpUnit.
>
> Unfortunately, I've not had time to write up a detailed tutorial on how
> to use it, which is probably going to halt most people in their tracks.
> I'll have to get to that one day....
>
> cjs
> --
> Curt Sampson <cjs@...> +81 90 7737 2974 http://www.NetBSD.org
> Don't you know, in this new Dark Age, we're all light. --XTC
